classData.comment:
/**

 */

classData.comment:
/**
     * Valid values for hideMode
     * @member {String[]} hideModes=['removeDom','visibility']
     * @protected
     * @static
     */
classData.description: Valid values for hideMode
classData.name: hideModes

classData.comment:
/**
     * True automatically applies the core.Observable mixin
     * @member {Boolean} observable=true
     * @static
     */
classData.description: True automatically applies the core.Observable mixin
classData.name: observable

classData.comment:
/**
         * @member {String} className='Neo.component.Base'
         * @protected
         */
classData.name: className

classData.comment:
/**
         * @member {String} ntype='component'
         * @protected
         */
classData.name: ntype

classData.description: The default alignment specification to position this Component relative to some other Component, or Element or Rectangle. Only applies in case floating = true.
classData.name: align_

classData.comment:
/**
         * The name of the App this component belongs to
         * @member {String|null} appName_=null
         */
classData.description: The name of the App this component belongs to
classData.name: appName_

classData.comment:
/**
         * True automatically mounts a component after being rendered.
         * Use this for the top level component of your app.
         * @member {Boolean} autoMount=false
         * @tutorial 02_ClassSystem
         */
classData.description: True automatically mounts a component after being rendered. Use this for the top level component of your app.
classData.name: autoMount

classData.comment:
/**
         * True automatically renders a component after being created inside the init call.
         * Use this for the top level component of your app.
         * @member {Boolean} autoRender=false
         * @see {@link Neo.component.Base#init init}
         * @tutorial 02_ClassSystem
         */
classData.description: True automatically renders a component after being created inside the init call. Use this for the top level component of your app.
classData.name: autoRender

classData.comment:
/**
         * CSS selectors to apply to the root level node of this component
         * @member {String[]} baseCls=[]
         */
classData.description: CSS selectors to apply to the root level node of this component
classData.name: baseCls

classData.comment:
/**
         * Bind configs to model.Component data properties.
         * Example for a button.Base:
         * @example
         * bind: {
         *     iconCls: data => `fa fa-{$data.icon}`,
         *     text   : data => data.foo.bar
         * }
         * @see https://github.com/neomjs/neo/blob/dev/examples/model
         * @member {Object|null} bind=null
         */
classData.description: Bind configs to model.Component data properties. Example for a button.Base:
classData.name: bind

classData.comment:
/**
         * Custom CSS selectors to apply to the root level node of this component
         * You can override baseCls to remove default selectors.
         * @member {String[]} cls_=null
         */
classData.description: Custom CSS selectors to apply to the root level node of this component You can override baseCls to remove default selectors.
classData.name: cls_

classData.comment:
/**

classData.description: manager.Focus will change this flag on focusin & out dom events

classData.comment:

classData.description: An array of domListener configs

classData.comment:
/**
         * Set this to true for bulk updates. Ensure to set it back to false afterwards.
         * Internally the value will get saved as a number to ensure that child methods won't stop the silent mode too early.
         * @member {Boolean} silentVdomUpdate_=false
         */
classData.description: Set this to true for bulk updates. Ensure to set it back to false afterwards. Internally the value will get saved as a number to ensure that child methods won't stop the silent mode too early.
classData.name: silentVdomUpdate_

classData.comment:
/**
         * You can pass an used theme directly to any component,
         * to style specific component trees differently from your main view.
         * @member {String|null} theme_=null
         */
classData.description: You can pass an used theme directly to any component, to style specific component trees differently from your main view.
classData.name: theme_

classData.comment:
/**
         * Add tooltip config object or a string containing the display text
         * See tooltip/Base.mjs
         *
         * By default, a single, shared Tooltip instance is used for all widgets which request
         * a tooltip. It reconfigures itself from the widget's definition just before showing.
         *
         * If a widget needs its own instance for any reason, inslude the property `ownInstance : true`
         * in the tooltip config object.
         * @member {Object|String} tooltip_=null
         */
classData.description:
Add tooltip config object or a string containing the display text See tooltip/Base.mjs

By default, a single, shared Tooltip instance is used for all widgets which request a tooltip. It reconfigures itself from the widget's definition just before showing.

If a widget needs its own instance for any reason, inslude the property ownInstance : true in the tooltip config object.
classData.name: tooltip_

classData.comment:
/**

classData.description: Add 'primary' and other attributes to make it an outstanding design

classData.comment:
/**
     * In case a component receives a new vnode, we want to do:
     * - sync the vdom ids
     * - setting rendered to true for child components
     * - updating the parent component to ensure that the vnode tree stays persistent
     * @param {Neo.vdom.VNode} [vnode=this.vnode]
     */
classData.description:
In case a component receives a new vnode, we want to do:

  • sync the vdom ids
  • setting rendered to true for child components
  • updating the parent component to ensure that the vnode tree stays persistent
classData.name: syncVnodeTree
